action.action-desc: Mr. Jacobs of New York (for himself and Mrs. Peltola) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to make certain activities for the removal of plastic waste and post-consumer materials from wastewater eligible for assistance under the State water pollution control revolving funds, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Reducing Plastics in Wastewater Act.

section.header: Removal of plastic waste and post-consumer materials

subsection.header: Projects and activities eligible for assistance
subsection.text: Section 603(c) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1383(c)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (11)(B), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in paragraph (12)(B), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

for the construction of improvements to treatment works owned and operated by a municipality to reduce and remove plastic waste and post-consumer materials, including microplastics and microfibers, from wastewater.

subsection.text: Section 603(i)(1) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1383(i)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A)(ii)(III), by striking ; or and inserting a semicolon;
in subparagraph (B)(iv), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: for an activity described in subsection (c)(13).
